docs.lead_paragraph: So-called specialty drugs for diseases like rheumatoid arthritis have a narrow use and high costs, leaving the most vulnerable patients with huge bills.

headline.seo: States Seek to Curb Exorbitant Drug Costs Incurred by Patients
headline.main: States Seek Curb on Patient Bills for Costly Drugs
headline.print_headline: States Seek Curb On Patient Bills For Costly Drugs

docs.abstract: Lawmakers in at least 20 states have introduced bills that would limit out-of-pocket payments by consumers for expensive drugs used to treat chronic diseases; bills aim to counter efforts by health plans to reduce the amount they pay for expensive medicines by making patients pay a percentage of the cost.
docs.snippet: So-called specialty drugs for diseases like rheumatoid arthritis have a narrow use and high costs, leaving the most vulnerable patients with huge bills.

headline.main: Why Do Americans Balk at Euthanasia Laws?

docs.abstract: What would need to change before the U.S. would legalize physician-assisted suicide?
docs.snippet: What would need to change before the U.S. would legalize physician-assisted suicide?

docs.lead_paragraph: Taking antidepressants during pregnancy raises the risk of high blood pressure in expectant mothers, a new study shows. Antidepressants are one of the most commonly used medications in pregnancy, and hypertension can cause problems for both mother and child. About one in five women suffer from depression during pregnancy, and up to 14 percent of those women end up using an antidepressant medication to treat it.

headline.main: Vital Signs: Risks: Checking Antidepressant Use in Pregnancy

docs.abstract: Anick Berard study in The British Journal of Clinical Pharmacology finds that taking antidepressants during pregnancy raises the risk of high blood pressure in expectant mothers. (M)
docs.snippet: Taking antidepressants during pregnancy raises the risk of high blood pressure in expectant mothers, a new study shows.      Antidepressants are one of the most commonly used medications in pregnancy, and hypertension can cause problems for both...

headline.main: Antidepressants Can Raise Blood Pressure During Pregnancy
headline.print_headline: Vital Signs: Risks: Checking Antidepressant Use in Pregnancy

docs.abstract: Taking antidepressants during pregnancy raises the risk of high blood pressure in expectant mothers, a new study shows.

docs.lead_paragraph: Experts say that doctors, despite the dangers, often keep patients on high-strength painkillers known as opioids for years without properly checking to see if their conditions improve.

headline.seo: Opioid Painkiller Prescriptions Pose Danger Without Oversight
headline.main: Tightening the Lid on Pain Prescriptions
headline.print_headline: Tightening the Lid On Pain Prescriptions

docs.abstract: Medical professionals are trying to curtail the overprescribing of high-strength painkillers known as opioids, which represent the most widely prescribed class of medications in the United States; Washington State lawmakers imposed new requirements on doctors to refer patients taking high dosages of opioids, which include hydrocodone, fentanyl, methadone and oxycodone, the active ingredient in OxyContin, for evaluation by a pain specialist if their underlying condition is not improving.
docs.snippet: Experts say that doctors, despite the dangers, often keep patients on high-strength painkillers known as opioids for years without properly checking to see if their conditions improve.

docs.lead_paragraph: Meet the woman who has become the face of Chile’s student protests.

headline.main: Camila Vallejo, the World’s Most Glamorous Revolutionary
headline.print_headline: ‘They Made Her an Icon, Which Is Impossible To Live Up To’

docs.abstract: Francisco Goldman article profiles Camila Vallejo, 23-year-old former president of the University of Chile student federation who has become the face of Chile's student protests.
docs.snippet: Meet the woman who has become the face of Chile’s student protests.
